reviews.review_msg: let us celebrate ourselves, our ethnicities ... no need for much thinking, come along for the ride, smile and say positive things, and no need to read the books

His class would be seen as nothing more than pop culture fodder if it wasn't for his remarkable attention to detail, and the fact he's extremely well read.  Peter has a lengthy theoretical library committed to memory which allows him to articulate on very 'trendy' works in a scholarly manner.

Peter is THE best English prof I've had at SFU. He is incredibly intelligent, motivated, and well-articulated. I actually enjoyed his class. The only downside is that he expects a lot from his students, but I guess that is to be expected w/ a 300 & 400-level classes.
Lectures are informative and exciting ... vested interest in course material ... gives feedback on areas needing improvement ... a great prof!
Do not take a class with this prof unless you are prepared for humiliation. She makes her students feel uncomfortable and forces them to speak out in class. She will put you on the spot.
if ya didn't like her, ya didn't get it.
